subject.geographic: No. 3 Front Levee st, New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD Will be given for the apprehension of the Boy EDOUARD, belonging to Mr. Alcée Labranche. Said boy absconded from the Steamboat Columbia, on her last trip from Texas, and has been seen lurking about the markets. Edouard is a Griffe, about 24 years of age, 5 feet 4 or 5 inches high, round face, thick hair, mouth rather sharp. Fifty dollars will be paid if taken in the state, or one hundred if out of the state. Captains of vessels or steamboats are cautioned not to harbor said boy. Apply to F J FORSTALL & BROTHER, 3 Front Levee street. jy6-tw
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
